member.summary: Override this method to provide a human friendly description of a method.

the parameters currently being passed to the method

member.name: M:StoryQ.Formatting.Methods.MethodFormatAttribute.UnCamel(System.String)
member.summary: Turns "SomeMethodName" into "Some method name".

member.name: T:StoryQ.Story
member.summary:
The [Story] story fragment. This is the root item of any story
Transitions:
In order to []:

member.name: T:StoryQ.Infrastructure.FragmentBase
member.summary: A StoryQ infrastructure class that is the base for all fluent interface classes

member.name: T:StoryQ.Infrastructure.IStepContainer
member.summary: Something that holds steps

member.name: M:StoryQ.Infrastructure.IStepContainer.SelfAndAncestors
member.summary: Enumerates over this and each of its ancestors. Reverse the collection to go through the story in correct order

member.name: M:StoryQ.Infrastructure.IStepContainer.Execute(StoryQ.Execution.Rendering.IRenderer[])
member.summary: Runs the current sequence of Steps against a renderer

member.name: P:StoryQ.Infrastructure.IStepContainer.Step
member.summary: Gets or sets the Step.

member.name: P:StoryQ.Infrastructure.IStepContainer.Parent
member.summary: Gets or sets the parent.

member.name: M:StoryQ.Infrastructure.FragmentBase.#ctor(StoryQ.Infrastructure.Step,StoryQ.Infrastructure.IStepContainer)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:StoryQ.Infrastructure.FragmentBase.StoryQ#Infrastructure#IStepContainer#SelfAndAncestors
member.summary: Enumerates over this and each of its ancestors. Reverse the collection to go through the story in correct order

member.name: M:StoryQ.Infrastructure.FragmentBase.Execute
member.summary: Runs the current sequence of steps, printing the results in plain text to the console.

member.name: M:StoryQ.Infrastructure.FragmentBase.ExecuteWithReport(System.Reflection.MethodBase)
member.summary: Runs the current sequence of Steps, reporting to an xml(+xslt) file augmented with jQuery widget for interactive viewing of the results. This method requires a reference to the "current" method in order to categorise results, you should pass in "MethodBase.GetCurrentMethod()". Reports are written to the current directory, look for an xml file beginning with "StoryQ". If you prefer to have a non interactive report (for example if you are using a legacy browser), set "StoryQSettings.ReportSupportsLegacyBrowsers = true"
member.param: The current method (use "MethodBase.GetCurrentMethod()")

member.name: M:StoryQ.Infrastructure.FragmentBase.ExecuteWithReport
member.summary: This overload infers the current method with 'new StackFrame(1).GetMethod()'. If it doesn't work, call the overload that takes a method Runs the current sequence of Steps, reporting to an xml(+xslt) file augmented with jQuery widget for interactive viewing of the results. This method requires a reference to the "current" method in order to categorise results, you should pass in "MethodBase.GetCurrentMethod()". Reports are written to the current directory, look for an xml file beginning with "StoryQ". If you prefer to have a non interactive report (for example if you are using a legacy browser), set "StoryQSettings.ReportSupportsLegacyBrowsers = true"

member.name: M:StoryQ.Infrastructure.FragmentBase.StoryQ#Infrastructure#IStepContainer#Execute(StoryQ.Execution.Rendering.IRenderer[])
member.summary: Runs the current sequence of Steps against a renderer

member.name: T:StoryQ.Scenario
member.summary:
The [Scenario] story fragment. The name of each scenario within a story. You can think of each scenario as a chapter in a book.
Transitions:
Given []:

member.name: M:StoryQ.Scenario.Given(System.Action)
member.summary: Given [Condition]. Provide the initial context to the scenario. Try not to describe behaviour or actions, this step describes and sets up initial state.
member.remarks: This overload infers its text from the name of the parameter
member.param: A descriptively named method that should be run to fulfil this story fragment. The method's name will be used as the description for this fragment, once converted from CamelCase Any underscores in the method's name will be used as placeholders and will be replaced with the of each respective argument. Do not use a lambda or anonymous method here, as the name will not be human readable
member.returns: The next fragment of your story, a

Do not use a lambda or anonymous method here, as the name will not be human readable
member.returns: The next fragment of your story, a

member.summary: And [Outcome]. Provide another resultant behaviour to check for
member.param: A textual description. This story fragment is not executable.
member.returns: The next fragment of your story, a

member.name: M:StoryQ.Outcome.WithScenario(System.String)
member.summary: With scenario [Scenario]. Add another scenario to this story. StoryQ executes these scenarios one after the other, so state can be shared between a single story's scenarios.
member.param: A textual description. This story fragment is not executable.
member.returns: The next fragment of your story, a

member.name: M:StoryQ.Outcome.Tag(System.String)
member.summary: Adds a tag to this step. Tags can be used make disparate steps searchable.

member.name: T:StoryQ.TextualSteps.Extensions
member.summary: Extension methods to enable string-based executable steps. These will always Pend

member.name: M:StoryQ.TextualSteps.Extensions.Given(StoryQ.Scenario,System.String)
member.summary: Given [Condition]. Provide the initial context to the scenario. Try not to describe behaviour or actions, this step describes and sets up initial state This story fragment should be executable, so a method is the preferred argument, but you can supply a string in the meantime. The step will Pend.
member.param: this
A textual description of the step.
member.returns: The next fragment of your story, a

member.name: M:StoryQ.TextualSteps.Extensions.And(StoryQ.Condition,System.String)
member.summary: And [Condition]. Provide another precondition to describe our scenario's initial state This story fragment should be executable, so a method is the preferred argument, but you can supply a string in the meantime. The step will Pend.
member.param: this
A textual description of the step.
member.returns: The next fragment of your story, a

member.name: M:StoryQ.TextualSteps.Extensions.When(StoryQ.Condition,System.String)
member.summary: When [Operation]. Describe the actions that are done to the system under test. ' This story fragment should be executable, so a method is the preferred argument, but you can supply a string in the meantime. The step will Pend.
member.param: this
A textual description of the step.
member.returns: The next fragment of your story, a

member.name: M:StoryQ.TextualSteps.Extensions.And(StoryQ.Operation,System.String)
member.summary: And [Operation]. Provide another action that is to be performed on the system, prior to our check for behaviour ('then') This story fragment should be executable, so a method is the preferred argument, but you can supply a string in the meantime. The step will Pend.
member.param: this
A textual description of the step.
member.returns: The next fragment of your story, a

member.name: M:StoryQ.TextualSteps.Extensions.Then(StoryQ.Operation,System.String)
member.summary: Then [Outcome]. Describe the system's behaviour that the prior state and actions should elicit This story fragment should be executable, so a method is the preferred argument, but you can supply a string in the meantime. The step will Pend.
member.param: this
A textual description of the step.
member.returns: The next fragment of your story, a

member.name: M:StoryQ.TextualSteps.Extensions.And(StoryQ.Outcome,System.String)
member.summary: And [Outcome]. Provide another resultant behaviour to check for This story fragment should be executable, so a method is the preferred argument, but you can supply a string in the meantime. The step will Pend.
member.param: this
A textual description of the step.
member.returns: The next fragment of your story, a

member.name: T:StoryQ.StoryQSettings
member.summary: This class is used to control global settings within storyQ. Refer to each member's documentation for details. It is recommended that you override these settings during the test suite setup phase of your test framework's execution, as it only needs to be done once.

member.name: P:StoryQ.StoryQSettings.DefaultMethodFormatSelector
member.summary: This function can be used to override the default formatting behaviour of StoryQ. If you don't override this, a selector will be provided that uses ParametersInlineMethodFormatAttribute if there are any underscores present, and ParameterSuffixedMethodFormatAttribute otherwise. If you have your own method formatter that you want to use globally, then you should set this property to a function that always returns an instance of your formatter.

member.name: P:StoryQ.StoryQSettings.DefaultParameterFormatter
member.summary: This function can be used to override the default formatting behaviour of StoryQ. If you don't override this, a selector will be provided that uses ParametersInlineMethodFormatAttribute if there are any underscores present, and ParameterSuffixedMethodFormatAttribute otherwise. If you have your own method formatter that you want to use globally, then you should set this property to a function that always returns an instance of your formatter.

member.name: P:StoryQ.StoryQSettings.PendingExceptionBuilder
member.summary:
This Func is responsible for wrapping an exception up in a unit test framework specific "pending" exception If you don't set the func manually, it will try to reflectively build an appropriate Func for itself. If this fails, you need to set the PendingExceptionBuilder manually
StoryQSettings.PendingExceptionBuilder = (message, inner) => new PendingException(message, inner);

member.name: P:StoryQ.StoryQSettings.ReportSupportsLegacyBrowsers
member.summary: If you set this to true, then StoryQ's ExecuteWithReport method will generate a non-interactive html page that works well in older browsers like IE6. If your entire team has access to a better browser than IE6, it's best to leave this "false"

member.name: T:StoryQ.Infrastructure.ExceptionHelper
member.summary: Exception-related operations for StoryQ.

member.name: M:StoryQ.Infrastructure.ExceptionHelper.CreateExceptionBuilder
member.summary: Tries to build an "exception builder" by scanning through the list of configured "pending exceptions" and creating a Func out of the constructor

member.name: M:StoryQ.Infrastructure.ExceptionHelper.TryForceStackTracePermanence(System.Exception,System.String)
member.summary: Uses forbidden .Net information to try and force the exception to keep its stack trace, even when rethrown http://stackoverflow.com/questions/1009762/how-can-i-rethrow-an-inner-exception-while-maintaining-the-stack-trace-generated/1009888#1009888
member.param: The exception to hack
the message to put between the real stack trace and the new one

the parameters currently being passed to the method

member.summary: Describes a method by un camel-casing the method, then replacing each underscore in the method name with each parameter value, in sequential order.
